raw_text:
Davies favours Gloucester future
 
 Wales hooker Mefin Davies is likely to stay with English side Gloucester despite reported interest from the Neath-Swansea Ospreys.
 
 BBC Wales understands the Ospreys are interested in the 32-year-old, but that he would prefer to stay where he is. Davies, one of the stars of Saturday's RBS Six Nations win over England, is only on a year contract at Kingsholm. But the hooker has proved his worth to the Zurich Premiership side and is likely to get a new deal next season. The summer demise of the Celtic Warriors region left Davies in the cold and forced him to take a semi-professional contract with Neath RFC. Although he got match time with the Ospreys at the request of the Wales management, he admitted before his move to Gloucester that he was angry with the way he was treated. "The WRU didn't give me any help off the field, it was very disappointing," Davies said at the time. "It was a hard time throughout the summer, then deciding whether to accept an offer from Stade Francais which would have ended my Wales career."

He is on a year contract but is set to get a new deal next season after his experience with the Zurich Premiership side has earned him recognition by Gloucester.

He had previously been in the cold after the demise of Celtic Warriors region and initially considered moving to Stade Francais to end his Wales career, citing a lack of support from the WRU.

tinyllama:1.1b:
Daviès fancié Gloucester futur
Le footballeur gallois Mefin Davies est certainement resté à Gloucester, après des intérêts suscités par les Ospreys anglais.
BFM TV rapporte que le 32 ans a été renouvelé pour un an sur papiers, mais que l'attaquant semble préférer se rendre chez lui en Suisse dans la saison prochaine.

Davies est actuellement sous contrat à Kingsholm de Zurich Premier Shpionage et s'est montré très utilisé lors du match de RBS Six Nations victorieux face aux Anglais, mais il a été retenu pour un demi-saute d’équipe avec les Ospreys après avoir rencontré le management des Celtiques.

Mais avant qu'il ne soit de retour auprès des Ospreys, il avait soulevé la curiosité du WRU en avançant que les chances de lui offrir un contrat sur peloton étaient limitées, ce qui a été très désagréable pour Davies.

"Le WRU n'avait pas fait d’aide à l'égard de mon comportement", s'expliqua-t-il avant son départ en Suisse, et il avait été impressionné par la façon dont cela aurait fait finir sa carrière de footballeur gallois.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Welsh hooker Mefin Davies has reportedly decided not to sign with the Neath-Swansea Ospreys, but instead will continue playing in Gloucester's senior team.
The 32-year-old has been a fan favorite at Kingsholm since taking up rugby in his youth, and has proven himself an integral part of the Celtic Warriors region' team.
However, he is entering the final year of his current contract with the Ospreys, which makes Gloucester an attractive option for him to continue his career in the English Premiership.

While the Welsh rugby federation may have been unhappy with the way they were treated during the summer, the fact remains that Davies has earned himself a new deal by performing exceptionally well for Gloucester.
The team has enjoyed strong performances under his leadership and is looking forward to continuing his successful tenure there.

He has been with Gloucester for several years and impressed them with his performance.
Despite having only a one-year contract with Kingsholm, it's likely that he will be awarded a new deal for next season.

Following the collapse of the Celtic Warriors region in summer, Davies took up a semi-professional contract with Neath RFC but has mainly played for Gloucester due to the encouragement of Wales management.
The player expressed disappointment with the way he was treated by the WRU during his time at the Celtic Warriors and considered offers from Stade Francais that could have ended his Wales career.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Mefin Davies, a 32-year-old Welsh hooker who played crucially in Saturday's RBS Six Nations victory over England for Gloucester, is expected to remain with the English club despite interest from the Ospreys.
Davies, currently on a one-year contract at Kingsholm, values his current situation and is likely to secure a new deal for next season.
His career path was disrupted in 2016 due to the Celtic Warriors' collapse, compelling him to sign a semi-professional deal with Neath RFC.

Although he briefly played for the Ospreys during that period at Wales' request, Davies expressed frustration over the Welsh Rugby Union's (WRU) lack of support off the field, which nearly ended his international career.
